title: Congressional leaders react to Jan. 6 pardons
shortDescription: House Republicans and Democrats react to President Donald Trump's Jan. 6 pardons.

title: This former president got love from Donald Trump at his inauguration. Here's why.
shortDescription: A previous president from Ohio could play a big role in shaping President Donald Trump's policies.

title: Trump calls for end to DEI programs
shortDescription: President Donald Trump is calling for an end to federal diversity, equity and inclusion, or DEI, programs.

title: What type of pen does Trump use to sign executive orders?
shortDescription: Video footage and pictures from the Oval Office show President Donald Trump signing off executive orders with a thick, black Sharpie.

title: Congressional leaders on immigration policy
shortDescription: Speaker Mike Johnson and Representative Pete Aguilar spoke on President Donald Trump's immigration policies.

title: On day two, Trump extended his long list of orders. See highlights
shortDescription: Trump continued full steam ahead on Tuesday after a busy Monday of executive orders. See highlights here.

title: Trump fumes at 'nasty' bishop who told him to 'have mercy'
shortDescription: President Trump called a bishop who pleaded with him to "have mercy" on migrants and the LGBTQ+ community "nasty" and "not very good at her job."

title: Trump admin to investigate local officials who hinder to immigration crackdown
shortDescription: The Justice Department will investigate state and local officials who stand in the way of President Donald Trump's immigration crackdown: memo.

title: President Trump's latest executive orders hit DEI and more; updates
shortDescription: Wednesday will mark President Donald Trump's second full day in office since being sworn in on Monday.

title: Why is Trump sending US military to the border?
shortDescription: Trump signed executive orders aimed at building military presence along the border and designating cartels as foreign terrorist groups, here's what's next.

title: Trump freed Proud Boys and Oath Keepers leaders. Who are they?
shortDescription: The leaders of the Proud Boys and the Oath Keepers were both freed from long sentences by President Donald Trump. Who are they? And what are their groups?

title: Trump pardons founder of illegal drug marketplace serving life in prison
shortDescription: Ulbricht, who used the nom de plume “Dread Pirate Roberts” to hide his identity, was sentenced in 2015 to life in prison.

title: Trump announces Stargate AI investment
shortDescription: President Donald Trump announced Stargate, a $500 billion investment in AI infrastructure. His attention then turned to TikTok ownership and tariffs.

title: Republican disagreement: GOP seems split on how to pursue Trump agenda
shortDescription: White House meeting Donald Trump and GOP leaders aimed to bring Republicans together on spending goals. But some disagreed on what was decided.

title: DOJ career officials reassigned to advance Trump immigration agenda
shortDescription: Justice Department career officials were reassigned to advance Donald Trump's immigration agenda, an official familiar with the matter told USA TODAY.

title: What is Stargate? Trump touts 'largest' AI venture with OpenAI, Oracle
shortDescription: Trump said the private sector joint venture will build data centers and create more than 100,000 jobs in the United States.

title: Trump says he's aiming for 10% tariff hike on imports from China
shortDescription: President Donald Trump said from the White House that he's looking at a 10% tariff on imports from China. He pushed Xi Jinping crack down on fentanyl.

title: Trump says he's open to Elon Musk buying TikTok
shortDescription: Trump on Monday issued an executive order that halts enforcement of a ban of TikTok for 75 days.

title: Missouri man who crashed U-Haul into White House barrier gets 8 years
shortDescription: Sai Varshith Kandula was sentenced to 8 years in prison after he crashed a truck near the White House and brandished a Nazi flag in 2023.

title: Diet Coke button returns to Donald Trump's Oval Office
shortDescription: The Diet Coke button returned to Donald Trump's Oval Office, offering the president immediate access to his favorite soda beverage.

title: Trump order 'putting people over fish' draws controversy in California
shortDescription: A Trump executive order directs agencies to 'to route more water' across the state. But some say there's a lot more at stake.

title: Trump rescinds policy preventing immigration arrests at schools
shortDescription: Trump's controversial decrees related to immigration, gender identity and the federal workforce could touch the lives of many students and families.

title: Trump cancels John Bolton's Secret Service security detail for second time
shortDescription: Bolton said that threat “remains today,” pointing to an Iranian plot to assassinate Trump before the 2024 election.

title: See photos from protests against Donald Trump's inauguration
shortDescription: Protests against Donald Trump's inauguration took place across the United States. See the photos.
